parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Arguments</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the driver of a vehicle. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Object]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''driver''' vehicle </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Object]] -  
The unit sitting in the driver place is returned. If vehicle is not a vehicle but a person, the person is returned. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>('''driver''' _tank) [[action]] ["getout", _tank];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>('''driver''' ([[vehicle]] [[player]])) [[isEqualTo]] [[player]] //check if player is driver of current vehicle</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[commander]], [[gunner]], [[crew]], [[currentPilot]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 3, 2006 - 14:32
<dt class="note">[[User:Hardrock|hardrock]]<dd class="note">''Notes from before the conversion:''

It is also possible to find the driver of a vehicle by placing a '''D''' after the name of the vehicle so ''Tank1D'' and '''''driver''' Tank1'' both refer to the same unit, providing the original driver has not got out of the tank.

The difference between the two is ''Tank1D'' is always the unit that was driver of the tank when the mission started, whilst '''''driver''' Tank1'' is the driver which is now there.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
